questions.question: To which of the following organizational level does the human heart belong?
The hydrocarbons contained in LP gas as its major components are
What is the unit of the amount of work?
Which of the following is not a characteristic of the cardiac muscle tissue?
Which of the following quantity increases uniformly in an object moving with a constant acceleration?
Which property of water causes water to be used as a cooling agent to remove excessive heat generated in an automobile engine?
answers: having a high specific heat capacity

questions.question: In the process of digestion of food, bile necessary for the emulsification of lipids is produced in the
What is the essential element for the production of thyroxine hormone in the thyroid gland?
How much is the mass of NaCl contained in 100 cm3 of a sodium chloride solution of concentration 1.0 mol dm-3? (Na = 23, Cl = 35.5)
The image of a real object produced by a convex mirror is always
answers: real and smaller than the object
real and larger than the object
virtual and smaller than the object
virtual and larger than the object
questions.correct_answer: virtual and smaller than the object

questions.question: What is the increasing order of pH of four solutions of HCl, CH3COOH, NaOH and NH3 of equal concentration?
The chemical formula of the chemical fertilizer urea is CO(NH2)2. Select the correct statement about urea.
answers: Urea possesses the properties of the constituent elements.
A molecule of urea has two carbon atoms.
A molecule of urea has four hydrogen atoms.
The total number of atoms in a urea molecule is seven.
questions.correct_answer: A molecule of urea has four hydrogen atoms.

questions.question: Which option contains only the components that are found in the glomerular filtrate but not in urine of a healthy person?

A jack fruit of mass 10 kg is falling freely from a height of 5 m of a jack tree. What is the velocity acquired by the fruit when it touches the ground? (Acceleration due to gravity is 10 ms-2. Assume that the resistance of air is negligibly small.)
Select the correct statement regarding the circulation of blood in humans.
answers: When circulated once through the body, blood goes twice through lungs
Left ventricle acts as the pump of systemic blood circulation
Always veins circulate blood away from the heart
questions.correct_answer: Left ventricle acts as the pump of systemic blood circulation

questions.question: Consider the following organs. A - skin B - kidneys C - pancreas Of these, those that contribute to maintain homoeostasis of the body is / are
Some information regarding an element are as follows.• Has several allotropic forms.•One allotropic form conducts electricity. This element is
. Some functions of the human brain are given below. A - reception of senses B - maintaining the balance of the body C - controlling the rate of heart beat Of the above, cerebellum controls
Consider the following statements. A - The rate of a reaction increases when the temperature increases. B - The kinetic energy of reactant particles increases when the temperature increases. Of these
answers: both statements A and B are true
statement A is true and statement B is false
both statements A and B are false
statement A is false and statement B is true
questions.correct_answer: both statements A and B are true

questions.question: Which of the following phenomena cannot be explained by the Archimedes principle?
answers: a ship cruising in the sea sinking more when entering a river
a balloon filled with helium gas moving upwards through air
floating of sunk orange seeds in a glass of orange juice when dissolving sugar
lifting a large mass by a hydraulic jack by applying a small force
questions.correct_answer: lifting a large mass by a hydraulic jack by applying a small force

questions.question: When thin iron wool is heated, it instantly burns. But though an iron nail is heated till red hot, it does not undergo a considerable change. What conclusion can be drawn from these observations?
answers: Iron wool acts as a catalyst
Iron wool and iron nail undergo reactions different from each other
The composition of iron wool and iron nail is different from each other
The rate of a reaction depends on the physical nature of the reactants
questions.correct_answer: The rate of a reaction depends on the physical nature of the reactants

questions.question: In 2011, the number of elephants in Sri Lanka was 5879. What is the most suitable biospherical organizational level to denominate that number of elephants?
Which of the following statements is false about electroplating of iron?
answers: An aqueous solution of a compound of the metal that is electroplated should be the electrolyte.
The electrolyte should be in high concentration for quality electroplating.
Iron should be made the cathode of the electrolytic cell.
The current used should be a direct current.
questions.correct_answer: The electrolyte should be in high concentration for quality electroplating.
